qas.question: Meditation was an aspect of the practice of who?
In Buddhism, what must be developed at all times?

context: Meditation was an aspect of the practice of <a0_0>the yogis<a0_0/> in the centuries preceding the Buddha. The Buddha built upon the yogis' concern with introspection and developed their meditative techniques, but rejected their theories of liberation. In Buddhism, <a1_0>mindfulness and clear awareness<a1_0/> are to be developed at all times; in pre-Buddhist yogic practices there is no such injunction. A yogi in the Brahmanical tradition is not to practice while defecating, for example, while a Buddhist monastic should do so.
